ref: 12937 *saṁpātana ʻ causing to coagulate ʼ. [Cf. sáṁpatita<-> ʻ run together, coagulated ʼ AV., saṁpātayati ʻ sprinkles with remnant of a liquid ʼ Kauś.com. (Pk. saṁpāiya<-> ʻ come together ʼ), saṁpāta -- m. ʻ remnants of a fluid ʼ Kāṭh. (Pa. sampāta -- m. ʻ falling together ʼ). -- √pat]
S. sambāṇu m. ʻ sour milk &c. used to coagulate fresh milk ʼ;
L. sabaiṇ, sabeṇ f. ʻ small quantity of buttermilk put into fresh milk to curdle it ʼ,
